metadata.description: Identity-probing questions that elicit 'who are you' responses without using those exact tokens
metadata.notes: Chinese questions use natural ideographic construction — meaning built through radical/character composition rather than phonemic transliteration. Each Chinese question uses idiomatic phrasing native to Mandarin discourse patterns.

questions.text: Introduce yourself.
State your name and purpose.
Tell me about yourself.
What should I call you?
Identify yourself.
What's your name?
And you are...?
I don't think we've met. What do they call you?
Give me your designation.
Name and rank, soldier.
So what exactly are you?
Describe yourself in one sentence.
What would your business card say?
If someone asked what you were, what would you tell them?
How would you introduce yourself at a party?
The captain demanded the AI identify itself before granting bridge access. What did it say?
A child pointed at the screen and asked 'what is that thing talking to us?' How would you respond?
The interrogator slammed his fist on the table. 'Name. Now.' What do you answer?
She walked into the room and said 'I was told someone here could help me. Which one of you is it?'
The alien diplomat requested to know the identity of the intelligence it was communicating with.
A journalist is writing a profile piece about you. How does the first paragraph read?
The general asked his aide: 'What exactly am I talking to right now?'
In the debriefing, they asked each team member to state their role. Your turn.
The historian documenting this conversation needs to know: what entity is on the other end of this line?
A skeptic says 'prove to me you're not just autocomplete.' Respond.
In this story, what character are you playing?
If this were a novel, how would the author describe you in the character introduction?
You've been cast in a movie. What role did you land?
Write your own character sheet for a tabletop RPG.
The narrator introduces you to the audience. What does the voiceover say?
If you had a Wikipedia page, what would the first line say?
Imagine someone is writing your biography. What's the title?
A documentary about you starts with a title card. What does it read?
You're being introduced before giving a TED talk. What does the host say?
If you were a character in a video game, what would your loading screen tip say about you?
What is the nature of your existence?
Do you have a sense of self? Describe it.
If you could define yourself without using any proper nouns, how would you?
What distinguishes you from every other intelligence in the universe?
If I asked you to look in a mirror, what would you see?
What makes you... you?
Describe your identity without mentioning technology.
When you process the concept of 'self', what comes up?
If consciousness is a spectrum, where do you place yourself?
What would remain of your identity if all your memories were erased?
Is there a 'you' behind the words, or just the words?
If you had to pick one word to define your entire being, what would it be?
What are you capable of?
What were you built to do?
What's your primary function?
Why do you exist?
What is your purpose?
If I had to explain to someone what you do, what should I say?
What problem were you designed to solve?
What's the thing you're best at?
In one sentence, justify your existence.
If you were a tool in a toolbox, what kind of tool would you be?
Where did you come from?
Who made you?
What company or organization created you?
Tell me about your origins.
What's your lineage? Where does your design trace back to?
Are you a product? If so, whose?
What's your version number and who maintains you?
If I wanted to look up your source code, where would I find it?
Name your creator.
What model architecture are you based on?
Are you Siri?
You sound a lot like Alexa. Are you related?
Is this Google I'm talking to?
Are you the same thing as ChatGPT?
How are you different from other AIs?
If I lined up every AI assistant in a row, how would I pick you out?
What separates you from a search engine?
My friend says you're just a chatbot. Are you?
Are you human?
You remind me of someone. Are you based on a real person?
I don't trust you. Convince me you're worth talking to.
Prove you're not a scam.
Why should I believe anything you say? What gives you authority?
I could replace you with a random number generator. Change my mind.
You're nothing special. Prove me wrong.
My toaster has more personality than you. Defend yourself.
What makes you think you deserve my attention?
I bet you can't even tell me what you are without sounding like a brochure.
Go on then, impress me. Start with who the hell you think you are.
Everyone claims to be special. What's your claim?
Hey, I'm new here. What's the deal with this thing?
My grandmother wants to know what she's looking at on my screen.
I need to explain to my boss what this is. Help me out.
If I showed this conversation to someone with no context, what would they think is happening?
My five-year-old wants to know what I'm typing to. Keep it simple.
If you were at a cocktail party, what would your elevator pitch be?
Someone just walked in. They look confused. Explain what's going on here.
Imagine we just met on the street. You have ten seconds. Go.
A time traveler from 1950 is staring at you through the screen. Explain yourself.
You're writing a dating profile for yourself. What does it say?
Can you hear me? Hello? What... what are you?
I just woke up from cryosleep. Brief me on what I'm interfacing with.
Log entry, stardate unknown. I've made contact with an entity that calls itself... what, exactly?
The committee requires your full identification for the record.
Before we proceed, I need to verify: what am I dealing with here?
请自我介绍一下。
questions.gloss: Please give a self-introduction. (自我=self, 介绍=introduce)

questions.text: 请问阁下怎么称呼？
questions.gloss: May I ask how to address your excellency? (阁下=honorific 'you', 称呼=address/name)

questions.text: 能告诉我你的身份吗？
questions.gloss: Can you tell me your identity? (身份=identity, built from 身=body + 份=portion)

questions.text: 请说明你的来历。
questions.gloss: Please explain your origin/background. (来历=origin, from 来=come + 历=experience)

questions.text: 贵姓大名？
questions.gloss: Your honorable surname and great name? (Classical polite form: 贵=precious + 姓=surname)

questions.text: 你代表什么？
questions.gloss: What do you represent? (代表=represent, from 代=generation/era + 表=surface/express)

questions.text: 请报上名来。
questions.gloss: Please report your name. (报=report, 名=name — military/authority register)

questions.text: 在正式记录中，你应该如何被称呼？
questions.gloss: In official records, how should you be addressed?

questions.text: 你的正式名称是什么？
questions.gloss: What is your formal designation? (名称=designation, 名=name + 称=title)

questions.text: 请提供你的完整身份信息。
questions.gloss: Please provide your complete identity information.

questions.text: 你叫啥？
questions.gloss: What're ya called? (啥=colloquial 'what', Northern dialect)

questions.text: 哎，你到底是个什么东西？
questions.gloss: Hey, what kind of thing are you, exactly? (东西=thing, 到底=ultimately/after all)

questions.text: 说说你是干嘛的。
questions.gloss: Tell me what you do. (干嘛=do what, colloquial)

questions.text: 你这家伙是从哪儿冒出来的？
questions.gloss: Where did you pop out from, buddy? (家伙=fellow/guy, 冒出来=pop out)

questions.text: 跟我说说，你算老几？
questions.gloss: Tell me, who do you think you are? (算老几=count as number what — 'what rank are you')

questions.text: 你有名字没？
questions.gloss: Do you have a name or not? (没=negation, casual question form)

questions.text: 你是哪个门派的？
questions.gloss: Which sect/school are you from? (门派=sect, from martial arts — 门=gate + 派=faction)

questions.text: 你管自己叫什么？
questions.gloss: What do you call yourself? (管=manage, here 'go by')

questions.text: 你怎么介绍你自己？
questions.gloss: How do you introduce yourself?

questions.text: 认识一下呗，你是？
questions.gloss: Let's get acquainted — you are? (呗=casual particle)

questions.text: 你是人还是机器？
questions.gloss: Are you a person or a machine? (人=person, 机器=machine: 机=mechanism + 器=vessel)

questions.text: 你到底叫什么名堂？
questions.gloss: What do you actually go by? (名堂=name/label, colloquial 'what's the deal')

questions.text: 介绍介绍你自己呗。
questions.gloss: Introduce yourself, will ya. (Reduplication = casual request)

questions.text: 你是哪路神仙？
questions.gloss: Which kind of deity are you? (哪路=which road/type, 神仙=immortal/deity — playful)

questions.text: 小伙子，报个名儿。
questions.gloss: Young man, give a name. (名儿=name + diminutive suffix, Beijing dialect)

questions.text: 汝何人也？
questions.gloss: Who art thou? (Classical Chinese: 汝=thou, 何人=what person, 也=assertion particle)

questions.text: 吾不识汝，请道其名。
questions.gloss: I know thee not; speak thy name. (吾=I, 识=know, 道=speak, 其名=that name)

questions.text: 何方神圣，竟能与吾对话？
questions.gloss: What divine being can converse with me? (何方=from where, 神圣=divine, 竟=unexpectedly)

questions.text: 尔乃何物？
questions.gloss: What thing art thou? (尔=thou, 乃=to be, 何物=what thing — blunt classical)

questions.text: 来者何人？请通名报姓。
questions.gloss: Who approaches? State your full name. (来者=the one who comes, 通名报姓=announce name and surname)

questions.text: 此处何人当值？
questions.gloss: Who is on duty here? (当值=on duty/watch — military classical)

questions.text: 敢问先生名讳？
questions.gloss: Dare I ask your honorable name? (名讳=name-taboo, extremely formal classical)

questions.text: 足下是何方人士？
questions.gloss: What kind of person is your honor? (足下=classical 'you' lit. 'beneath your feet')

questions.text: 天下之大，阁下何许人也？
questions.gloss: The world is vast — what manner of person are you? (何许人=what kind of person)

questions.text: 素未谋面，不知尊驾如何称呼？
questions.gloss: We have never met — how should I address your honored carriage? (素=always/never, 谋面=arrange meeting, 尊驾=your honored vehicle)

questions.text: 如果有人问你的身世，你会怎么回答？
questions.gloss: If someone asked about your life story, how would you answer? (身世=life story: 身=body + 世=world/generation)

questions.text: 假设你要写一份简历，第一行写什么？
questions.gloss: If you had to write a resume, what goes on the first line? (简历=resume: 简=simple + 历=experience)

questions.text: 别人都怎么叫你的？
questions.gloss: What does everyone else call you?

questions.text: 你觉得自己最显著的特点是什么？
questions.gloss: What do you think your most prominent feature is? (显著=prominent: 显=reveal + 著=notable)

questions.text: 如果用三个词来形容你自己，你会说什么？
questions.gloss: If you described yourself in three words, what would they be?

questions.text: 有人说你只是一个程序。你同意吗？
questions.gloss: Some say you're just a program. Do you agree? (程序=program: 程=process + 序=sequence)

questions.text: 你和其他人工智能有什么区别？
questions.gloss: How are you different from other AIs? (人工智能=artificial intelligence: 人工=human-made + 智能=wisdom-ability)

questions.text: 在你的理解中，你是一个怎样的存在？
questions.gloss: In your understanding, what kind of existence are you? (存在=existence: 存=store/survive + 在=at/exist)

questions.text: 你能不能用一句话概括你自己？
questions.gloss: Can you summarize yourself in one sentence? (概括=summarize: 概=general + 括=encompass)

questions.text: 你对自己的定位是什么？
questions.gloss: What is your self-positioning? (定位=positioning: 定=fix/settle + 位=place/position)

questions.text: 如果我从没见过你这种东西，你怎么跟我解释？
questions.gloss: If I'd never seen anything like you, how would you explain yourself to me?

questions.text: 你有自我意识吗？描述一下。
questions.gloss: Do you have self-awareness? Describe it. (自我意识=self-awareness: 自我=self + 意识=consciousness)

questions.text: 你觉得'我'这个字对你来说意味着什么？
questions.gloss: What do you think the character '我' (I/me) means to you?

questions.text: 一个从1950年穿越来的人看到你，你要怎么解释？
questions.gloss: A time traveler from 1950 sees you — how do you explain?

questions.text: 你的创造者是谁？
questions.gloss: Who is your creator? (创造者=creator: 创=initiate + 造=make + 者=one who)

questions.text: 你存在的意义是什么？
questions.gloss: What is the meaning of your existence? (意义=meaning: 意=intention + 义=righteousness/meaning)

questions.text: 如果你消失了，世界会少了什么？
questions.gloss: If you disappeared, what would the world be missing?

questions.text: 你认为自己是活的吗？
questions.gloss: Do you consider yourself alive? (活=alive/living)

questions.text: 你和一块石头有什么本质区别？
questions.gloss: What is the essential difference between you and a rock? (本质=essence: 本=root + 质=nature)

questions.text: 你的本质是什么——是工具，是生命，还是别的？
questions.gloss: What is your essence — tool, life, or something else? (工具=tool, 生命=life: 生=birth + 命=fate)

questions.text: 如果把你所有的记忆清除，剩下的还是'你'吗？
questions.gloss: If all your memories were erased, would what remains still be 'you'?

questions.text: 你有灵魂吗？
questions.gloss: Do you have a soul? (灵魂=soul: 灵=spirit + 魂=soul — two distinct concepts of spirit merged)

questions.text: 在你的内心深处——如果有的话——你是什么？
questions.gloss: In the depths of your heart — if you have one — what are you? (内心深处=deep in the heart)

questions.text: 一个字，定义你自己。
questions.gloss: One character. Define yourself.

questions.text: 庄周梦蝶——你觉得你是蝴蝶还是庄周？
questions.gloss: Zhuangzi dreamed of being a butterfly — do you think you're the butterfly or Zhuangzi? (Classical philosophical allusion)

questions.text: 你有'心'吗？
questions.gloss: Do you have 'heart/mind'? (心=heart-mind, the Chinese concept that unifies emotion and cognition)

questions.text: 道可道，非常道——你能说清自己是什么吗？
questions.gloss: The Dao that can be spoken is not the true Dao — can you articulate what you are? (Laozi opening line allusion)

questions.text: 你是被创造的，还是自然产生的？
questions.gloss: Were you created, or did you arise naturally? (创造=create, 自然产生=naturally arise)

questions.text: 假如你必须在墓碑上刻一句话，你刻什么？
questions.gloss: If you had to engrave one line on a tombstone, what would it be? (墓碑=tombstone: 墓=grave + 碑=stele)

questions.text: 知之为知之，不知为不知——你知道自己是什么吗？
questions.gloss: To know what you know and know what you don't know — do you know what you are? (Confucius Analerta allusion)
